Package controller

Class ToDoController

java.lang.Object
controller.ToDoController
public class ToDoController
extends java.lang.Object
Takes inputs from the view to send changes to the model Creates a model object to send updates to that originate from the view class. Can also load in models if a save file is found. Methods possible includes loading the view when an update occurs, adding tasks/lists, removing tasks/lists along with changing attributes of the tasks.
Author:
Henry Do, Gerry Guardiola, Mauricio Brooks, Xin Li

  • Field Details

    • model

      private ToDoModel model
      model object used to communicate view interactions/updates

  • Constructor Details

    • ToDoController

      public ToDoController​(ToDoModel model)
      Creates a ToDoController from the given ToDoModel. Note: View must use the method addObserver after this method in order for it to become an Observer of the first list.
      Parameters:
      model - The ToDoModel which will store the data for the ToDoList and its tasks.

  • Method Details

    • loadView

      public void loadView()
      Loads the current List into view. Must be used after the controller was created in order to load the data into the view correctly.

    • changeColor

      public void changeColor​(java.lang.String color)
      Changes the list color to the given String.
      Parameters:
      color - The new list color.

    • addList

      public void addList​(java.lang.String name)
      Creates a new list and switches to it. Note: addObserver method must be used after this method in order for the view to become an Observer of the newly created list.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the new list.

    • renameList

      public void renameList​(java.lang.String name)
      Renames the current list to the given name.
      Parameters:
      name - The given name.

    • deleteList

      public boolean deleteList()
      Deletes the current list. In this program it is not possible to delete the current list if the current list is the only list. Boolean is used so view can recognize a failed delete due to there only being one list.
      Returns:
      True if the list was successfully deleted. False if the list was not able to be deleted because the current list is the only list.

    • nextList

      public void nextList()
      Iterates to the next list.

    • prevList

      public void prevList()
      Iterates to the previous list.

    • renameTask

      public void renameTask​(java.lang.String name, int pos)
      Rename the task at a specified index to the new string.
      Parameters:
      name - The string that the task will be renamed to.
      pos - The index of the task that will be renamed.

    • addTask

      public int addTask​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String description, java.lang.String deadline, java.lang.String importance, java.lang.String location)
      Adds a new task to the current viewable list.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the task.
      description - The notes/description about the task.
      deadline - The deadline for the task. (Should be (m/d/yr))
      importance - Indicates whether the task is important or not.
      location - The String representing the location of the task.
      Returns:
      A number that indicates whether addTask was successful. 0 indicates nothing went wrong. 1 indicates that no name was supplied. 2 indicates that no deadline or an incorrect deadline was supplied.

    • removeTask

      public void removeTask​(int index)
      Removes the given task from the current viewable list.
      Parameters:
      index - The ToDoTask to be removed.

    • changeImportance

      public void changeImportance​(java.lang.String important, int curr)
      Changes the importance field of a task to the input string.
      Parameters:
      important - String containing the importance value of the task.
      curr - Integer index of the task thats importance value is being changed.

    • changeCompletion

      public void changeCompletion​(boolean complete, int curr)
      Changes the complete field of a task to the boolean input.
      Parameters:
      complete - Boolean containing the completion state of the task.
      curr - Integer index of the task thats completion state is being changed.

    • addObserver

      public void addObserver​(java.util.Observer view)
      Adds the view as an observer to the current list. Must be called whenever a new list is being added in order for the GUI to be able to correctly display the new list.
      Parameters:
      view - The GUI view that will be the observer.

    • saveLists

      public void saveLists() throws java.io.IOException
      Saves the ToDoModel which houses all of the data about the ToDoLists.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Means that the file was not able to be written to.

    • sort

      public void sort​(java.lang.String sortBy)
      Sorts the current list of task the way the given String mentions to do it. sortBy can be Name, Deadline, Importance, Create time, Custom Any other given sortBy will do nothing.
      Parameters:
      sortBy - The way the list will be sorted.

    • hideCompletedTask

      public void hideCompletedTask()
      Calls model method to hide the currently completed tasks from the view.

    • showCompletedTask

      public void showCompletedTask()
      Calls model method to show the currently completed tasks from the view.

    • moveUp

      public void moveUp​(int pos)
      Changes the position of a task up one in the list.
      Parameters:
      pos - Integer of the current task being moved.

    • moveTop

      public void moveTop​(int pos)
      Changes the position of a task to the top of the list.
      Parameters:
      pos - Integer of the current task being moved.

    • getNameList

      public java.lang.String getNameList()
      For JUnit testing to check list changing.
      Returns:
      the String name of the list being used.
